citeinfo.origin: Japan Agency for Marine-Earth Science and Technology (JAMSTEC)
citeinfo.title: JAMSTEC Deep Seafloor Image Database

abstract.p: Deep seafloor images collected by manned submergence vehicles SHINKAI2000 and SHINKAI6500 and unmanned underwater vehicles DOLPHIN 3K and KAIKO. The number of images entered in the database is about 300,000 as of January 2003 and 250,000 of them are open to the public. We continue to enter images in the database. The database is available to the public via the Internet.

Images are made available after two years from its original photographed date. Page numbers and photo numbers of the photos are numbered according to the albums in the storage room. Numbers are not consecutive. Images are of sea creatures and topography. Images are available in JPEG format.

descript.purpose: To allow users to search vast images from the deep seafloor collected by JAMSTEC.

idinfo.useconst: All images and text in this database are copyrighted to JAMSTEC. For non-profit use, specify JAMSTEC copyright. For profit use, contact JAMSTEC.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
